intro: Encyclia holguinensis, commonly known as the Holguín's orchid, is a species of orchid native to Cuba. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, terrestrial growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
